gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT11 - CTD - PUMP Sample Logs from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: CTD - PUMP Sample Logs (.jpg files) Dataset Description: <p>GT11/KN204-01 A/B PUMP Sample Logs (.pdf files)<br /><b>Note: No sample logs contributed for PUMP/SHALLOW Casts</b></p> Acquisition Description: <p>Hand written sample logs generated by science party aboard vessel.</p>

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30094.rdf Name: description Units: text Description: Description of the contents of the .pdf file http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30095.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30096.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Originally submitted as 'cast'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30097.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Originally submitted as 'event'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30098.rdf Name: type Units: text Description: Cast/Instrument Type http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30099.rdf Name: date Units: YYYYMMDD Description: Date http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30100.rdf Name: time Units: HHMMSS Description: Time http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30101.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude (South is negative) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30102.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude (West is negative) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/30103.rdf Name: samplelog Units: text Description: Filename and link for the sample log .pdf file http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32401.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: text Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33222.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.ssZ Description: Date/Time formatted to ISO 8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated using 'date' and 'time' parameters as input.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Description of the contents of the .pdf file; General Description: dataset_id: a unique combination of alpha and/or numeric characters designating a dataset (filename in many cases)

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Originally submitted as 'cast'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Originally submitted as 'event'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.
PI-supplied Description: Cast/Instrument Type; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Date; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Filename and link for the sample log .pdf file; General Description: dataset_id: a unique combination of alpha and/or numeric characters designating a dataset (filename in many cases)

PI-supplied Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde); General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time formatted to ISO 8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated using 'date' and 'time' parameters as input.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Short Name:McLane Pump Instrument Description: McLane pumps sample large volumes of seawater at depth. They are attached to a wire and lowered to different depths in the ocean. As the water is pumped through the filter, particles suspended in the ocean are collected on the filters. The pumps are then retrieved and the contents of the filters are analyzed in a lab.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
